text.p: Netscape Communications Corp. said it has completed the acquisition of two private companies --DigitalStyle Corp. and Portola Communications, Inc. - as part of its bid to become the top supplier of Internet software to networked businesses.
DigitalStyle is a Web graphics tools vendor and developer of Java-based animation, while Portola Communications offers high-performance messaging systems.
Under the terms of the deals, first disclosed at the end of April, Netscape said it purchased 100 percent of the outstanding capital stock of both companies.
Both acquisitions are intended to be accounted for as purchase transactions for which Netscape is due to have issued 2.0 million shares of its common stock.
In addition, Netscape said it anticipates that a substantial portion of the purchase price will be written off as in-process research and development this quarter.
